thread.title: Police: Purse stolen from Land Rover at Glencoe Golf Club - Glencoe News
thread.title_full: Police: Purse stolen from Land Rover at Glencoe Golf Club - Glencoe News

author: Daniel I. Dorfman
title: Police: Purse stolen from Land Rover at Glencoe Golf Club - Glencoe News
text:
The following items were taken from Glencoe Public Safety Department reports and press releases. An arrest does not constitute a finding of guilt.
WARRANT ARREST
Anthony E. Smith, 35, of the 1200 block of Geneva Street, Racine, Wis., was arrested on a charge of failing to appear in court in connection with another case at 4:52 a.m. on Sept. 6 after he was stopped with a disabled vehicle on the 700 block of Dundee Road, police said. He was transported to the Cook County courthouse with no further information available.
SUSPENDED LICENSE
Iman J. Parker, 24, of the 7900 block of South Chappel Avenue, Chicago, was charged with driving on a suspended license and a headlight violation at 10:29 p.m. Sept. 10 after she was stopped on the 700 block of Dundee Road, police said. She was released on a $1,500 bond and has a scheduled court date of Oct. 2 in Skokie.
BURGLARY FROM MOTOR VEHICLE
A purse was reported stolen at 2:43 p.m. Sept. 7 from a silver Land Rover parked at the Glencoe Golf Club on the 600 block of Westley Road after the rear passenger window was broken, police said. Damage to the vehicle was estimated at $250 with the loss of the property stolen still pending.
CRIMINAL DAMAGE
A park bench seat located at the intersection of Old Green Bay Road and South Avenue was reported broken at 1:13 Sept. 5, police said. Damage was estimated to be $75.
 Crime Theft Glencoe Geneva
